intro: Anemone indeterminata, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces elongated seed pods that split open to release seeds. Anemone indeterminata is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
